website_summaries.verdict: The Dymo LabelManager Wireless PnP label printer can connect either via USB to a single PC or by Wi-Fi to your network to print rugged plastic and fabric labels.
cons: No apps available for printing from phones or tablets

customer_reviews.title: No redeeming qualities
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this device. It would be great to have Wifi printer of labels. However, I couldn't get it to work. The quality was very poor. Would have missing parts of letters. I couldn't get the software to work on my computer and fell back on just running the executable on the printer itself. Finally it won't print at all. Head cleaning didn't help. Don't waste your money or time on this or any printer from Dymo. I am buying a P-touch next. They have always worked in all their incarnations.
customer_reviews.author: DHG

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money to get a better one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because it wasn't too expensive. I actually wish I'd spent the money to get a better one. It's okay if you need to print out about 10 labels, but it's pretty slow. I needed about 50 labels printed out, and watching paint dry would be faster. It has also jammed on me quite a few times. If you only need to print a label every now and then, this will get the job done. If you're going to be labeling things often, please spend the money and get a more expensive one that can do the job faster.
customer_reviews.author: Normalization

customer_reviews.title: MAC USERS IMPORTANT SETUP INFO
customer_reviews.text: Mac Users!!!!!!!! This product will not work if you plug it into your computer before you install the software. Please follow these Steps: 1) Download 8.5.2 from the Dymo website under support 2) Run the installer, It has some crazy hang time on the install. It takes forever for some reason. 3) Plug in the Dymo If you messed up and plugged it in first make sure you remove it from the computer and go to the printer preferences and remove it from there as well. This is tricky and odd setup but works great once you do.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bachman

customer_reviews.title: ... works well as a label printer and is overall easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: The Dymo Wireless PNP works well as a label printer and is overall easy to setup, the one thing you have have to know is this product WILL NOT work consistently when connecting to a Wireless N network. You either need to have a router/ap that is Wireless G only or have one radio on your router/ap that you can set to wireless g. But if the DYMO connects via wireless N it will not process print jobs consistently. (yes it has the ability to connect via wireless n dymo themselves admits its unsupported). So keep that in mind and this product will work fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: N. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Wasted Label Space
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that this label printer would allow for quicker printing and typing then the label printers with built in keyboards. It can make it quicker if you just need basic labels. Anything past that becomes hard and annoying. I really didn't like how much dead space there is in the labels. Almost every time I have to cut off the excess so the labels will actually fit where I need them. Changing the font size doesn't help the dead space at all. This design could definitely be improved upon.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this printer if you are using a Mac with OSX Sierra
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in September 2016 and it worked great on my Mac running OSX El Capitan. I upgraded my OS to Sierra recently and the printer stopped working. I called Dymo tech support and they said that this unit is not compatible with Sierra and that they had no ETA for a fix. Now the printer is an expensive paperweight and I am stuck with a bunch of unusable Dymo label cartridges. I do not see how a brand new printer can be made incompatible with a major OS upgrade from a major computer supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great portable label printer for bar codes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to print bar codes on inventory stock & because it's portable. It prints bar codes great , but have to download Dymo software from their web site to print bar codes, the built in software doesn't. The 1" wide D1 tape, black print on white tape is best for a bar code & alphanumeric number. Anything narrower , and you can't read alphanumeric number except with magnifying glass, plus the scanner might not read the bar code. Portability is Great though. Can go wherever you laptop can go.
customer_reviews.author: D. Micoletti

customer_reviews.title: Good gadget but prints badly
customer_reviews.text: the idea / concept is great and it does what its meant to BUT........ it prints very poor quality (I was using red lettering on clear tape), it was barely legible. Using black on white was great. Having it import my address book for label printing is very useful. It prints from clip art but cannot print images at all well. If your looking for a decent label machine, get the wired / usb version, I got the wireless one for network printing from all users at home which it does very well
customer_reviews.author: Tonka

customer_reviews.title: Good labels, but this device has a few small issues.
customer_reviews.text: This device could be better. Wi-fi configuration doesn't stay setup (requires tinkering/resetting). If you run it connected to the computer and turn the PC off overnight, the printer won't be ready to print the next day, because the battery will be too low (even though it's plugged in). I'm a little underwhelmed with the core features... but the labels are decent, and I can't gripe about the price.
customer_reviews.author: coryalex

customer_reviews.title: Labels how and when you want them
customer_reviews.text: The default software works great, seconds to set up, and the stand-up design is great for a cluttered desk. I could not get the premium software (a download by the push of a button in the default software) to load correctly (Windows 7 Ultimate) so I've only been able to use the default software. The printer prints labels, up to 1" wide, with multiple lines if you want, so it does what I needed it to.
customer_reviews.author: BostonBob

customer_reviews.title: tape is bad
customer_reviews.text: The tape is horrible, it has very little adhesive quality and doesn't stick to the simplest of items. The heat only makes it worse and I have to add double stick tape to make it work. I will be looking to send this purchase back, which is to bad because I like the label maker and the software.
customer_reviews.author: hsymrkii

customer_reviews.title: Great unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought the non wifi and it a waste of money if you need labels bigger than 1/2, if you need 1' you MUST buy this model. I have not test wifi I just needed 1" Labels and it works great for that, Plus this model cuts each label the non model you have to push a button on it to cut, it a pain to do each time. Pay the extra $20 or what ever to get the wifi model.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Withey

customer_reviews.title: Labels for this machine are expensive
customer_reviews.text: Replacement labels for this machine are expensive. In the range of .20 each. Other Dymolabel printers have replacement labels that are much cheaper, closer to .03 each. Since we wanted a wireless network label printer we switched to a brother label printer for this instance. We do have a regular dymolabel that we have had for years which has been wonderful. Not sure why they could design this one to use the same inexpensive labels as that one.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: this printer has wifi issues and poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, this printer has wifi issues and poor battery life. Plus the print quality of my printer is fair to poor. Not recommended. I consider it mostly a miracle if I get this thing worker. What a pile of dog doo.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Twain

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a paperweight. Installed and work for ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a paperweight. Installed and work for 1 night. Now I get so aggravated with I give up.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton ICT

customer_reviews.title: You can not print across on the label, you ...
customer_reviews.text: You can not print across on the label, you are limited to one Letter across and then the next letter moves down to the next line. You can print the length of the label as long as you want but that is not what I want to do.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Includes: LabelManager Wireless PnP Label Maker, D1 Starter ...
customer_reviews.text: Includes: LabelManager Wireless PnP Label Maker, D1 Starter Label Black on White, 1" x 10', Rechargeable Battery Pack, USB Power Adapter, Quick Start Card and Reference Guide, 1-Year Limited Warranty. My box came with no label maker! bummer!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Dynomite!
customer_reviews.text: The label maker works well and prints all different size labels. It took a little time to set it up to my PC but after that, it is easy to use. The only negative is that it is not portable like a handheld label maker, but it is wireless which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Magra

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased three of these printers within a six ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these printers within a six month span. They work well for a month or so and then start going downhill. It is not one specific problem either; the issues range from the cutting device failing, to the labels getting wrapped around the spool, etc. Will look for a different label maker that is more reliable for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Home Use!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a more expensive label maker that finally wore out; now, that I am retired - I really didn't need that any more - just use the labels for personal use. This was really easy to set up and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jean F.

customer_reviews.title: Struck Out Twice
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my most frustrating purchases in a while. The first one I received printed OK for the first dozen or so labels in the first month, but then began printing with blank stripes running through all of the text. Cleaning the print head as advised did not correct the issue, so I returned for a replacement. (There were also wireless issues, but since the printer itself does not work properly, its pointless to address that). The brand new replacement unit printed with the same problem right out of the box! See photo. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Deep Thought

customer_reviews.title: i returned and purchased a brother pt p700 and works great and half the
customer_reviews.text: was never able to make it wireless, i tried and tried and didnt work the only was to have it connected. i returned and purchased a brother pt p700 and works great and half the price
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Shooting Blanks
customer_reviews.text: Do the label cartridges go bad because all I'm getting are blanks off of the demo cassette?
customer_reviews.author: Price

customer_reviews.title: Battery died in a week after device arrived.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery died in a week after device arrived...had to wait for several month before new one became available to buy...new battery died in 3 days...also there is a issue with two line printing, it was needed to reboot device after each print out
customer_reviews.author: Ltd

customer_reviews.title: works - doesnt save any time.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't save me anytime to use this vs writing the label - software takes to long. not worth my money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hill

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend buying this printer because design flaw
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year the battery will not fully charge making the printer a paperweight. I would not recommend buying this printer because design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Not a lover of the quality of this item. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a lover of the quality of this item. The labels are just okay. Looking for a different barcode printer.
customer_reviews.author: LYHB

customer_reviews.title: Good product except for the Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Good Printer except I wouldn't recommend the Wifi model. Battery goes flat if left plugged into the computer and then you can't use it until its charged, connection is slow. Rather just use it as a USB printer but this is not even possible if the battery is flat.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Needs work to be usable
customer_reviews.text: Does not sync with Mac desctop, labels are not looking professional
customer_reviews.author: Rado Kalla

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work wireless with MAC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was wireless with MAC. It is not. So what I have is a unit that promised to be wireless and it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: SassySassy1

customer_reviews.title: I really like this, But
customer_reviews.text: I really like this, But, The program is kind of difficult to use and understand I hope they work on that to make it a little user friendly. But I gave it a 5 star because it is a tough little machine. I really like it and it does not take up much space and is attractive in its appearance. I will just have to get used to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money when the Lithium Ion battery need replacing
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it makes decent labels but once the Lithium ion battery fails the cost to replace it is prohibitive, around $25.00. Dymo makes this inexpensive for a reason. I would avoid this type of model.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine, but not flawless
customer_reviews.text: I like this machine best for its wireless capabilities. Using a laptop as my primary computer and often moving around, it is nice to not have to park somewhere to plug in. I am fine with just being in the neighborhood of it. It also can be unplugged from wall even so it makes for a convenient label maker. I think my least favorite thing is that it does not go wider than the 1 inch. At this price, it would be nice if you could have it go a bit wider. As with any label maker, there is ridiculous amounts of waste at the ends. I have never had a label maker that did not do this...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Office
customer_reviews.text: Many of us use the DYMO label printers in our office and the printers overall are expensive, but we have them at each of our desks. This was really a godsend, allowing us to share the label printer much the same we share printers in our office. Set-up was easy and, long-term we'll save money this way. There's a bit of a nuisance sharing something this small, so the sharing really will be in areas where we have 5 computers aligned in a row and 5 printers. This wouldn't be practical if you had persons in two offices sharing the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Newby

customer_reviews.title: but my joy turned sour when I found that there is a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this being Mac & wireless...but my joy turned sour when I found that there is a required 0.4" margin at the start of the label...GAAAAK!...my old P-Touch Brother likes to cut off a piece at the start of the label, wasting tape and making a mess, but does allow the print to start really close to the beginning of the label...we can land a probe on a comet, but alas printing at the start of a label is beyond man kind...
customer_reviews.author: andrew wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Did not print clearly
customer_reviews.text: The text was streaked with white areas. The edges of the letters were uneven. Some letters were distorted. I called Dymo and spoke with a very nice CSR. She talked me through cleaning the print head. The problem remained. I installed a second cartridge and the problem remained. She recommended that the printer and cartridges be returned for exchange. The software works flawlessly in Windows XP. The cable connection was sufficient for my needs. I did not use the wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gibb

customer_reviews.title: love it! super simple to set up!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the small business owner or just that person that feels the need to label everything! Upon taking this out for the box I was pleased at just how easy it was to set it up! It's plug and play! It even included the labels that you need to get started. you can buy other colors for the label maker if you wanted as well. My husband set this up and we were printing labels in no time! My children even know how to make the labels now! Let the organizing begin!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Sack

customer_reviews.title: Really good as long as it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this label maker quite well. Then suddenly the tape wouldn't come out. I opened it and saw that the tape doesn't move. I bought a new tape but unfortunately the tape still doesn't move. Disappointed but will buy the same again and see if this new one will work properly more than a couple of months. It's a convenient printer but only if it works. I've given it three stars but it's good as long as it works.
customer_reviews.author: P. Austin

product_meta.title: DYMO LabelManager Rechargeable Hand-Held Label Maker
product_meta.description:
No software to install. Just plug into PC or Mac, and create great-looking, durable labels. Wireless lets you share with everyone on your network. Create custom labels with using fonts and graphics on your PC or Mac. Print graphics, barcodes and logos in professional-quality 300 dpi resolution. Uses easy-peel, split-back D1 tape (1/4-, 3/8-, or 1/2-inch sizes). Thermal printing creates labels with no ink or toner. Automatic label cutter makes multi-label printing effortless. 1 year limited warranty. Includes rechargeable battery pack, USB power adapter, USB cable, and 1-inch D1 starter label cassette black on white.

Compatible with Windows 7 or later and Mac OS X v10.8 or later. Microsoft and Windows are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries. Mac and OS X are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
feature_bullets: Wireless lets you share with everyone on your network and stores multiple individual and enterprise wireless networks for automatic recognition
No software to install, just plug into PC or Mac*, and create great-looking labels as fast as you can type
Portable label maker's powerful lithium-ion battery recharges via USB connection – no power adapter or AA batteries needed
Customize labels with crystal-clear graphics, barcodes, and logos at 300 dpi resolution through PC or Mac* connection and it includes an automatic label cutter
Compatible with DYMO D1 labels in 1/4", 3/8", 1/2", 3/4", and 1" wide in a variety of colors. Not compatible with D1 Durable labels
Includes: LabelManager Wireless PnP Label Maker, D1 Starter Label Black on White, 1" x 10', Rechargeable Battery Pack, USB Power Adapter, Quick Start Card and Reference Guide, 1-Year Limited Warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.9 out of 5 stars80 ratings2.9 out of 5 stars
